column15: What is your annual household income?
column16: What was your overall impression of this event (quality, lighting, sound, value)?
column17: Please share any other suggestions or ideas that would help us enhance your experience at Gesa Power House Theatre. If you would like someone to respond to your feedback, please include your contact information. Thank you!

column16: This was a wonderful experience! The music and the fiddlers themselves made for a great evening. The ticket price was surprisingly low for the quality of the show. We love the Gesa Powerhouse Theater!
I loved this event.  I was sad the audience didn't clap or seem to enjoy more.  A very reserved crowd tonight!  Thanks to all the volunteers for always making this such a pleasant experience.

The Nordic Fiddlers were absolutely excellent musicians and performers!  My adult daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed this concert!!!  Please bring them back again and again.  The quality, lighting, sound, and value were excellent.  Thank you for a very enjoyable evening.
column17:
https://www.bing.com/videos/search?q=gothard+sisters+hummingbird&view=detail&mid=9ACFAA751BE2464C3B309ACFAA751BE2464C3B30&FORM=VIRE
I would really like to see the Gesa PHT bring The Gothard Sisters here.  They are a Celtic group comprised of three beautiful and very talented musicians.  I have attached a link to their YouTube video performance of "Hummingbird" - a song that they wrote.  They are based in Edmonds, Washington (in the Seattle area).  They are very well known in the USA.

column16: We love the theater!!  Wish the microphones were turned up a little more. Speaking voices are hard to hear/understand for older ears. 😘
Incredible talent and wished more WW folks had taken the time to enjoy their fabulous show.
Enjoyable.  The A/C was a little forceful or I was right under a vent, as I got cold.
Absolutely phenomenal. Best show yet, in our opinion.

The venue is beautiful - I’ve never been before. The sound was great quality and I enjoyed the event a lot. The lighting was a bit much, there was a lot of changes in the light and I especially didn’t like it when they shined the light on the audience, not my favorite. The value was good for the money - it was beautiful and definitely worth it.
column17: Thanks for having great staff and a great venue!
It would be nice for performances like this to have a screen with photos/videos of their come countries, or dancers or something interpretative like that.

column16: Incredible! Immaculate vibes and a very intimate experience :)

It was a wonderful event, with great quality value, lighting, and sound. The theatre staff were welcoming, kind, and helpful. I felt that the length of the show and intermission was just right, it was a very enjoyable evening.
column17:
I didn’t know/notice if there were any programs readily available and that would have been nice to look at — or a QR code that we could scan in the lobby for information on the show.
(I also could have missed seeing them or where they were available)

column16: Beautiful performance!! Lighting and sound were great. We enjoy the Gesa Power House and the diverse performances.

Very entertaining, 
good, 
good 
and good!

Loved the feel but was unimpressed with the house lights turning on just for the performers to "see our response." As a viewer I was taken out of the experience more than two times due to the house lights being on. Reference the russia tour of Billy Joel when he explains how much of an AV fail that is. When the house lights go down...keep em down. If the artist requests to have the audience a bit visible for the use of a practical part of the show that is planned, suggest other lighting sources from the stage such as the warmer lights used half way between the first act, to reflect on the audience. This venue is small enough to not have to worry about a disconnect from the performer to the audince, so I will stand by the fact that the house lights should stay down unless it is an emergency or intermission...or over lol.
column17: I would say that I would have loved for the security guard to have come down near the isle to reprimand the clown who had his flash on multiple times for pictures, instead of him being so near the stage and talking down to the front row. It was almost equally as distracting as the flashing light from the clown audience member. so if something like that happens to try to be stealthy before being tough. ninja not barbarian ;)
